Name: Plain Work Robe
Description: Generic apprentice work robes. Starter equipment.

Name: Silk Robe
Description: Fine silk robes that resonate with magical energy.

Name: Winter Cloak
Description: Heavy wool cloak designed for the frozen highlands.

Name: Velvet Robe
Description: Luxurious velvet robes. Best non-unique equipment.

Name: Plain Belt
Description: A simple leather belt for holding pouches.

Name: Studded Belt
Description: Reinforced leather belt with metal studs.

Name: Dragon Hide Belt
Description: Tough belt crafted from authentic dragon hide.

Name: Leather Boots
Description: Basic sturdy boots for exploring the academy.

Name: Hardened Boots
Description: Reinforced boots for better protection.

Name: Dragon Skin Boots
Description: Lightweight and indestructible dragon skin footwear.

Name: Leather Gloves
Description: Simple gloves for handling magical ingredients.

Name: Hardened Gloves
Description: Reinforced gloves for stable spellcasting.

Name: Dragon Skin Gloves
Description: Ancient dragon skin provides superior power.

Name: Pointed Hat
Description: The quintessential wizard headwear.

Name: Heavy Cloak
Description: A thick heavy cloak that dampens physical blows.

Name: Starched Cloak
Description: Chemically treated cloak that resists magical ailments.

Name: Wooden Beads
Description: A simple necklace of enchanted wooden beads.

Name: Crystal Beads
Description: Necklace made of magic-conducting crystals.

Name: Spectacles
Description: Enchanted glasses that improve focus and hit rate.

Name: Abe no Seimei
Description: Legendary Japanese onmyoji master of spirits.

Name: Baba Yaga
Description: Slavic witch who flies in a mortar.

Name: Circe
Description: Greek goddess famous for beast transformation.

Name: Merlin
Description: The quintessential advisor to kings and master of prophecy.

Name: Morgan le Fay
Description: Powerful enchantress of Avalon and master healer.

Name: Nicholas Flamel
Description: Creator of the Philosopher's Stone.

Name: Marie Laveau
Description: The Voodoo Queen of New Orleans.

Name: Hecate
Description: Titaness of magic crossroads and the moon.

Name: Faust
Description: Scholar who bartered his soul for infinite knowledge.

Name: Medea
Description: Expert in herbs poisons and dark enchantments.

Name: Paracelsus
Description: Pioneer of elemental studies and alchemy.

Name: Thoth
Description: Ancient Egyptian god of wisdom and divine magic.

Name: Cassandra
Description: Prophetess cursed to never be believed.

Name: Solomon
Description: Biblical king with power over many spirits.

Name: Michael Scot
Description: Medieval polymath and imperial wizard.

Name: Völva
Description: Norse seeress and practitioner of Seidr magic.

Name: Antidote
Description: A standard medicinal brew that neutralizes most common toxins.

Name: Rock Cake
Description: A very hard traditional fruit cake. Mind your teeth!

Name: Wolfsbane
Description: Highly toxic plant also known as Aconite. Used in specialized potions.

Name: Monkshood
Description: A variety of Aconite with hood-shaped flowers.

Name: Wormwood
Description: A bitter herb essential for brewing Draught of Living Death.

Name: Asphodel
Description: A lily-like flower associated with the afterlife and mourning.

Name: Mandrake Root
Description: A root that resembles a human. Its cry is fatal when mature.

Name: Bezoar
Description: A stone taken from the stomach of a goat. Saves you from most poisons.

Name: Aconite
Description: A general term for highly toxic plants like Wolfsbane.

Name: Beetle Eyes
Description: Small crunchy eyes used as a catalyst in low-level brews.

Name: Cornelius Agrippa
Description: Historic occultist and writer.

Name: Cyclops
Description: One-eyed giant of Greek myth.

Name: Goliath
Description: Ancient giant warrior from history.

Name: Dragon
Description: Legendary fire-breathing reptile of immense power.

Name: Giant
Description: Massive humanoid of immense strength.

Name: Vampire
Description: Immortal creature of the night that drinks blood.

Name: Imp
Description: Small mischievous devil of germanic folklore.

Name: Pixie
Description: Tiny flying trickster of british folklore.

Name: Gnome
Description: Earth-dwelling garden spirit defined by Paracelsus.

Name: Unicorn
Description: Pure white horse with a single horn.

Name: Griffin
Description: Majestic creature half lion half eagle.
